name: packet
description:
A Pulumi package for creating and managing X cloud resources.

> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-packet` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-packet/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/issues).

authToken.description: The API auth key for API operations.

cidr.description: bit length of the network mask of the address
bit length of the network mask of the address

public.description: whether the address is routable from the Internet

bonded.description:
Whether this port is part of a bond in bonded network setup
* `project_id`- The ID of the project the device belongs to

mac.description: MAC address assigned to the port

maxPrefix.description: The maximum number of route filters allowed per server

status.description: status of BGP configuration in the project

cidr.description: Bit length of the network mask of the address

public.description: Whether the address is routable from the Internet

bonded.description: Whether this port is part of a bond in bonded network setup

mac.description: MAC address assigned to the port

asn.description: Autonomous System Numer for local BGP deployment

deploymentType.description: `private` or `public`, the `private` is likely to be usable immediately, the `public` will need to be review by Packet engineers

maxPrefix.description: The maximum number of route filters allowed per server

md5.description: Password for BGP session in plaintext (not a checksum)

status.description: status of BGP configuration in the project

provider.description:
The provider type for the packet package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/index.html.markdown.

authToken.description: The API auth key for API operations.

packet:index/bgpSession:BgpSession.description:
Provides a resource to manage BGP sessions in Packet Host. Refer to [Packet BGP documentation](https://www.packet.com/developers/docs/network/advanced/local-and-global-bgp/) for more details.

You need to have BGP config enabled in your project.

BGP session must be linked to a device running [BIRD](https://bird.network.cz) or other BGP routing daemon which will control route advertisements via the session to Packet's upstream routers. 

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/r/bgp_session.html.markdown.

defaultRoute.description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.
Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering BgpSession resources.

defaultRoute.description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.

packet:index/device:Device.description:
Provides a Packet device resource. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete devices.

> **Note:** All arguments including the `root_password` and `user_data` will be stored in
 the raw state as plain-text.
[Read more about sensitive data in state](https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/sensitive-data.html).

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/r/device.html.markdown.

accessPrivateIpv4.description: The ipv4 private IP assigned to the device

accessPublicIpv4.description: The ipv4 maintenance IP assigned to the device

accessPublicIpv6.description: The ipv6 maintenance IP assigned to the device

alwaysPxe.description:
If true, a device with OS `custom_ipxe` will
continue to boot via iPXE on reboots.

created.description: The timestamp for when the device was created

deployedFacility.description: The facility where the device is deployed.

facilities.description: List of facility codes with deployment preferences. Packet API will go through the list and will deploy your device to first facility with free capacity. List items must be facility codes or `any` (a wildcard). To find the facility code, visit [Facilities API docs](https://www.packet.com/developers/api/facilities), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

forceDetachVolumes.description: Delete device even if it has volumes attached. Only applies for destroy action.

hardwareReservationId.description:
The ID of hardware reservation which this device occupies
* `hostname`- The hostname of the device

ipAddresses.description: A list of IP address types for the device (structure is documented below).

ipxeScriptUrl.description:
URL pointing to a hosted iPXE script. More
information is in the
[Custom iPXE](https://www.packet.com/developers/docs/servers/operating-systems/custom-ipxe/)
doc.

networks.description:
The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. When a device is run without any special network configuration, it will have 3 networks: 
* Public IPv4 at `packet_device.name.network.0`
* IPv6 at `packet_device.name.network.1`
* Private IPv4 at `packet_device.name.network.2`
Elastic addresses then stack by type - an assigned public IPv4 will go after the management public IPv4 (to index 1), and will then shift the indices of the IPv6 and private IPv4. Assigned private IPv4 will go after the management private IPv4 (to the end of the network list).
The fields of the network attributes are:

operatingSystem.description: The operating system slug. To find the slug, or visit [Operating Systems API docs](https://www.packet.com/developers/api/operatingsystems), set your API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

plan.description: The device plan slug. To find the plan slug, visit [Device plans API docs](https://www.packet.com/developers/api/plans), set your auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

projectId.description: The ID of the project in which to create the device

publicIpv4SubnetSize.description:
Size of allocated subnet, more
information is in the
[Custom Subnet Size](https://www.packet.com/developers/docs/servers/key-features/custom-subnet-size/) doc.

rootPassword.description: Root password to the server (disabled after 24 hours)

sshKeyIds.description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user and project SSH keys

storage.description: JSON for custom partitioning. Only usable on reserved hardware. More information in in the [Custom Partitioning and RAID](https://www.packet.com/developers/docs/servers/key-features/cpr/) doc.

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the device was updated

userData.description: A string of the desired User Data for the device.

waitForReservationDeprovision.description: Only used for devices in reserved hardware. If set, the deletion of this device will block until the hardware reservation is marked provisionable (about 4 minutes in August 2019).

alwaysPxe.description:
If true, a device with OS `custom_ipxe` will
continue to boot via iPXE on reboots.

List items must be facility codes or `any` (a wildcard). packet:index/ipAttachment:IpAttachment.description:
Provides a resource to attach elastic IP subnets to devices.

To attach an IP subnet from a reserved block to a provisioned device, you must derive a subnet CIDR belonging to
one of your reserved blocks in the same project and facility as the target device.

For example, you have reserved IPv4 address block 147.229.10.152/30, you can choose to assign either the whole
block as one subnet to a device; or 2 subnets with CIDRs 147.229.10.152/31' and 147.229.10.154/31; or 4 subnets
with mask prefix length 32. More about the elastic IP subnets is [here](https://www.packet.com/developers/docs/network/basic/elastic-ips/).

Device and reserved block must be in the same facility.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/r/ip_attachment.html.markdown.

cidr.description: length of CIDR prefix of the subnet as integer

cidrNotation.description:
CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same
project and facility as the device

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet

gateway.description: IP address of gateway for the subnet

netmask.description: Subnet mask in decimal notation, e.g. "255.255.255.0"

public.description: boolean flag whether subnet is reachable from the Internet

cidrNotation.description:
CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same
project and facility as the device

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering IpAttachment resources.

cidr.description: length of CIDR prefix of the subnet as integer

cidrNotation.description:
CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same
project and facility as the device

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet

gateway.description: IP address of gateway for the subnet

netmask.description: Subnet mask in decimal notation, e.g. "255.255.255.0"

public.description: boolean flag whether subnet is reachable from the Internet

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Organization resources.

packet:index/portVlanAttachment:PortVlan.description:
Provides a resource to attach device ports to VLANs.

Device and VLAN must be in the same facility.

If you need this resource to add the port back to bond on removal, set `force_bond = true`.

To learn more about Layer 2 networking in Packet, refer to

* https://www.packet.com/resources/guides/layer-2-configurations/ 
* https://www.packet.com/developers/docs/network/advanced/layer-2/

## Attribute Referece

* `id` - UUID of device port used in the assignment
* `vlan_id` - UUID of VLAN API resource
* `port_id` - UUID of device port

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/r/port_vlan_attachment.html.markdown.

deviceId.description: ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

forceBond.description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false.

native.description: Mark this VLAN a native VLAN on the port. This can be used only if this assignment assigns second or further VLAN to the port. To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use `depends_on` pointing to another packet_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above.

portName.description: Name of network port to be assigned to the VLAN

deviceId.description: ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

forceBond.description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false.

native.description: Mark this VLAN a native VLAN on the port. This can be used only if this assignment assigns second or further VLAN to the port. To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use `depends_on` pointing to another packet_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above.

portName.description: Name of network port to be assigned to the VLAN

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering PortVlanAttachment resources.

deviceId.description: ID of device to be assigned to the VLAN

forceBond.description: Add port back to the bond when this resource is removed. Default is false.

native.description: Mark this VLAN a native VLAN on the port. This can be used only if this assignment assigns second or further VLAN to the port. To ensure that this attachment is not first on a port, you can use `depends_on` pointing to another packet_port_vlan_attachment, just like in the layer2-individual example above.

portName.description: Name of network port to be assigned to the VLAN

bgpConfig.description: Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Packet guide for BGP](https://www.packet.com/developers/docs/network/advanced/local-and-global-bgp/).

organizationId.description: The UUID of organization under which you want to create the project. If you leave it out, the project will be create under your the default organization of your account.

paymentMethodId.description: The UUID of payment method for this project. The payment method and the project need to belong to the same organization (passed with `organization_id`, or default).

packet:index/projectSshKey:ProjectSshKey.description:
Provides a Packet project SSH key resource to manage project-specific SSH keys.
Project SSH keys will only be populated onto servers that belong to that project, in contrast to User SSH Keys.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/r/project_ssh_key.html.markdown.

created.description: The timestamp for when the SSH key was created

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the SSH key

name.description: The name of the SSH key for identification

ownerId.description: The ID of parent project (same as project_id)

projectId.description: The ID of parent project

publicKey.description: The public key. If this is a file, it can be read using the file interpolation function

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the SSH key was updated

name.description: The name of the SSH key for identification

projectId.description: The ID of parent project

publicKey.description: The public key. If this is a file, it can be read using the file interpolation function

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ProjectSshKey resources.

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the SSH key

ownerId.description: The ID of parent project (same as project_id)

projectId.description: The ID of parent project

packet:index/reservedIpBlock:ReservedIpB.description:
Provides a resource to create and manage blocks of reserved IP addresses in a project.

When a user provisions first device in a facility, Packet API automatically allocates IPv6/56 and private IPv4/25 blocks.
The new device then gets IPv6 and private IPv4 addresses from those block. It also gets a public IPv4/31 address.
Every new device in the project and facility will automatically get IPv6 and private IPv4 addresses from these pre-allocated blocks.
The IPv6 and private IPv4 blocks can't be created, only imported. With this resource, it's possible to create either public IPv4 blocks or global IPv4 blocks.

Public blocks are allocated in a facility. Addresses from public blocks can only be assigned to devices in the facility. Public blocks can have mask from /24 (256 addresses) to /32 (1 address). If you create public block with this resource, you must fill the facility argmument.

Addresses from global blocks can be assigned in any facility. Global blocks can have mask from /30 (4 addresses), to /32 (1 address). If you create global block with this resource, you must specify type = "global_ipv4" and you must omit the facility argument.

Once IP block is allocated or imported, an address from it can be assigned to device with the `packet..IpAttachment` resource.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/r/reserved_ip_block.html.markdown.

cidr.description: length of CIDR prefix of the block as integer

cidrNotation.description: Address and mask in CIDR notation, e.g. "147.229.15.30/31"

facility.description: Facility where to allocate the public IP address block, makes sense only for type==public_ipv4, must be empty for type==global_ipv4

global.description: boolean flag whether addresses from a block are global (i.e. can be assigned in any facility)

network.description: Network IP address portion of the block specification

projectId.description: The packet project ID where to allocate the address block

public.description: boolean flag whether addresses from a block are public

quantity.description: The number of allocated /32 addresses, a power of 2

type.description: Either "global_ipv4" or "public_ipv4", defaults to "public_ipv4" for backward compatibility

facility.description: Facility where to allocate the public IP address block, makes sense only for type==public_ipv4, must be empty for type==global_ipv4

projectId.description: The packet project ID where to allocate the address block

quantity.description: The number of allocated /32 addresses, a power of 2

type.description: Either "global_ipv4" or "public_ipv4", defaults to "public_ipv4" for backward compatibility

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ReservedIpBlock resources.

cidr.description: length of CIDR prefix of the block as integer

cidrNotation.description: Address and mask in CIDR notation, e.g. "147.229.15.30/31"

facility.description: Facility where to allocate the public IP address block, makes sense only for type==public_ipv4, must be empty for type==global_ipv4

global.description: boolean flag whether addresses from a block are global (i.e. can be assigned in any facility)

network.description: Network IP address portion of the block specification

projectId.description: The packet project ID where to allocate the address block

public.description: boolean flag whether addresses from a block are public

quantity.description: The number of allocated /32 addresses, a power of 2

type.description: Either "global_ipv4" or "public_ipv4", defaults to "public_ipv4" for backward compatibility

packet:index/spotMarketRequest:SpotMarke.description:
Provides a Packet Spot Market Request resource to allow you to
manage spot market requests on your account. For more detail on Spot Market, see [this article in Packing documentaion](https://www.packet.com/developers/docs/getting-started/deployment-options/spot-market/).

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/r/spot_market_request.html.markdown.

packet:index/sshKey:SshKey.description:
Provides a resource to manage User SSH keys on your Packet user account. If you create a new device in a project, all the keys of the project's collaborators will be injected to the device.

The link between User SSH key and device is implicit. If you want to make sure that a key will be copied to a device, you must ensure that the device resource `depends_on` the key resource.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/r/ssh_key.html.markdown.

created.description: The timestamp for when the SSH key was created

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the SSH key

name.description: The name of the SSH key for identification

ownerId.description: The UUID of the Packet API User who owns this key

publicKey.description:
The public key. If this is a file, it
can be read using the file interpolation function

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the SSH key was updated

name.description: The name of the SSH key for identification

The public key. If this is a file, it
can be read using the file interpolation function

plan.description: The service plan slug of the volume

projectId.description: The packet project ID to deploy the volume in

size.description: The size in GB to make the volume

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the volume was updated

deviceId.description: The ID of the device to which the volume should be attached

volumeId.description: The ID of the volume to attach

deviceId.description: The ID of the device to which the volume should be attached

volumeId.description: The ID of the volume to attach

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering VolumeAttachment resources.

deviceId.description: The ID of the device to which the volume should be attached

volumeId.description: The ID of the volume to attach

packet:index/getDevice:getDevice.description:
Provides a Packet device datasource.

> **Note:** All arguments including the `root_password` and `user_data` will be stored in
 the raw state as plain-text.
[Read more about sensitive data in state](https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/sensitive-data.html).

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/d/device.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getDevice.

projectId.description: The id of the project in which the devices exists

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDevice.

accessPrivateIpv4.description: The ipv4 private IP assigned to the device

accessPublicIpv4.description: The ipv4 management IP assigned to the device

accessPublicIpv6.description: The ipv6 management IP assigned to the device

billingCycle.description: The billing cycle of the device (monthly or hourly)

facility.description: The facility where the device is deployed.

hardwareReservationId.description: The id of hardware reservation which this device occupies

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

networkType.description: L2 network type of the device, one of "layer3", "layer2-bonded", "layer2-individual", "hybrid"

networks.description:
The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. When a device is run without any special network configuration, it will have 3 networks: 
* Public IPv4 at `packet_device.name.network.0`
* IPv6 at `packet_device.name.network.1`
* Private IPv4 at `packet_device.name.network.2`
Elastic addresses then stack by type - an assigned public IPv4 will go after the management public IPv4 (to index 1), and will then shift the indices of the IPv6 and private IPv4. Assigned private IPv4 will go after the management private IPv4 (to the end of the network list).
The fields of the network attributes are:

operatingSystem.description: The operating system running on the device

plan.description: The hardware config of the device

rootPassword.description: Root password to the server (if still available)

sshKeyIds.description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user or project SSH keys

packet:index/getIpBlockRanges:getIpBlock.description:
Use this datasource to get CIDR expressions for allocated IP blocks of all the types in a project, optionally filtered by facility.

There are four types of IP blocks in Packet: global IPv4, public IPv4, private IPv4 and IPv6. Both global and public IPv4 are routable from the Internet. Public IPv4 block is allocated in a facility, and addresses from it can only be assigned to devices in that facility. Addresses from Global IPv4 block can be assigned to a device in any facility.

The datasource has 4 list attributes: `global_ipv4`, `public_ipv4`, `private_ipv4` and `ipv6`, each listing CIDR notation (`<network>/<mask>`) of respective blocks from the project.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/d/ip_block_ranges.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getIpBlockRanges.

facility.description: Facility code filtering the IP blocks. Global IPv4 blcoks will be listed anyway. If you omit this, all the block from the project will be listed.

projectId.description: ID of the project from which to list the blocks.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getIpBlockRanges.

globalIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Global IPv4 blocks in the project

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

ipv6s.description: list of CIDR expressions for IPv6 blocks in the project

privateIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Private IPv4 blocks in the project

publicIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Public IPv4 blocks in the project

packet:index/getOperatingSystem:getOpera.description:
Use this data source to get Packet Operating System image.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/d/operating_system.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getOperatingSystem.

name.description: Name or part of the name of the distribution. Case insensitive.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getOperatingSystem.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

packet:index/getOrganization:getOrganiza.description:
Provides a Packet organization datasource.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/d/organization.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getOrganization.

organizationId.description: The UUID of the organization resource

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getOrganization.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

projectIds.description: UUIDs of project resources which belong to this organization

packet:index/getPrecreatedIpBlock:getPre.description:
Use this data source to get CIDR expression for precreated IPv6 and IPv4 blocks in Packet.
You can then use the cidrsubnet TF builtin function to derive subnets.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/d/precreated_ip_block.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getPrecreatedIpBlock.

addressFamily.description: 4 or 6, depending on which block you are looking for.

facility.description: Facility of the searched block. (Optional) Only allowed for non-global blocks.

global.description: Whether to look for global block. Default is false for backward compatibility.

projectId.description: ID of the project where the searched block should be.

public.description: Whether to look for public or private block.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getPrecreatedIpBlock.

cidrNotation.description: CIDR notation of the looked up block.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

packet:index/getProject:getProject.description:
Use this datasource to retrieve attributes of the Project API resource.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/d/project.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getProject.

name.description: The name which is used to look up the project

projectId.description: The UUID by which to look up the project

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getProject.

backendTransfer.description: Whether Backend Transfer is enabled for this project

bgpConfig.description: Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Packet guide for BGP](https://www.packet.com/developers/docs/network/advanced/local-and-global-bgp/).

created.description: The timestamp for when the project was created

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

organizationId.description: The UUID of this project's parent organization

paymentMethodId.description: The UUID of payment method for this project

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the project was updated

userIds.description: List of UUIDs of user accounts which beling to this project

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getSpotMarketPrice.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getSpotMarketPrice.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

price.description: Current spot market price for given plan in given facility.

packet:index/getSpotMarketRequest:getSpo.description:
Provides a Packet spot_market_request datasource. The datasource will contain list of device IDs created by referenced Spot Market Request.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/d/spot_market_request.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getSpotMarketRequest.

requestId.description: The id of the Spot Market Request

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getSpotMarketRequest.

deviceIds.description: List of IDs of devices spawned by the referenced Spot Market Request

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

packet:index/getVolume:getVolume.description:
Provides a Packet Block Storage Volume datasource to allow you to read existing volumes.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-packet/blob/master/website/docs/d/volume.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVolume.

projectId.description: The ID the parent Packet project (for lookup by name)

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVolume.

billingCycle.description: The billing cycle, defaults to hourly

deviceIds.description: UUIDs of devices to which this volume is attached

facility.description: The facility slug the volume resides in

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

locked.description: Whether the volume is locked or not

name.description:
The name of the volume
* `project_id ` - The project id the volume is in

plan.description: Performance plan the volume is on

size.description: The size in GB of the volume

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing X cloud resources.
